title: How to configure the forward / reply message preamble
content:
Hi,

I've been a Thunderbird user since the days of Eudora ;-) and have a configuration question.

When you forward or reply to a message, Thunderbird currently does this: <sender> wrote on <date> <time>: 

  forwarded message text

Is there a way to change the preamble line, or is it hard-coded?

Thanks in advance for any pointers.
creator: doinkdoink

title: Can't open inbox after restart. Getting Error - inbox on TB message
content:
This is what the message says. It got hung up after the DONATE message posted. i donated, but it didn't free it up.

"Unable to open the folder Inbox on robert@perless.com because it is in use by some other operation. Please wait for that operation to finish and then select the folder again."

Apple says it is a TB problem, not an Apple problem. Somebody please help.

I am running this computer for my late husband who left us in September after he fell off a 25' ladder at the age of 85. It still has all the information from his art. He was a sculptor who made large kinetic pieces.

Please help. Ellen Perless ellen@perless.com
creator: rperless

title: Nezobrazují se některé štítky
content:
Dobrý den, mohla bych poprosit o pomoc se štítky - zprávy se mi některými nedaří označit. Když přidám štítek ke zprávě, tak se okamžitě zase tento štítek zruší. Když se snažím několikrát po sobě štítek přidat, vydrží tam pár vteřin, ale zase stejně po chvíli zmizí. Taky se mi nezobrazují tyto štítky v horní liště při filtraci štítků. Štítky jsem zkoušela smazat a vytvořit znovu, ale stejně to nepomohlo.

Předem děkuji, jsem bez nich celkem ztracená...
creator: prodej

title: Binnenkomende mail
content:
Goedemorgen, Ik ben helaas a- technisch in deze dus ga ik dit maar proberen. Sinds enkele dagen kan ik plots wel gewoon mails verzenden maar niet meer ontvangen. Als ik via bestand, nieuwe berichten op halen voor, alle accounts klik krijg ik de volgende melding midden in het scherm te zien.

Kan de e-mail niet naar de postbus schrijven. Zorg ervoor dat u schrijfrechten hebt op het bestandssysteem en dat u genoeg schijfruimte hebt om de postbus te kopiëren.

Wie mij wil helpen, mail me aub op; jhamstra@caiway.nl Bij deze mijn hartelijke dank

title: Number of emails shown to be downloaded has become incorrect
content: Today (for example) I saw a message 'Downloading message n of 182 messages' (n increasing with every message downloaded but the message disappearing well before 182). According to the activity manager and my own reckoning 72 were downloaded. An incorrect number of messages to be downloaded has been shown every day since 26 April 2024 although my previous download was on 20 April when the number that day (and on previous days going back many years) was correct. I have included messages in the Junk folder in my reckoning. The account is POP mail server and my Thunderbird version is 115.10.1 (64 bit). Not life threatening but can I fix this or can a recent change be corrected as I found the number being downloaded figure useful when it was correct.

content: I have a Thunderbird on my old windows computer. I just installed it on my new computer (and I donated). I could have sworn that I had the import/export tool on the old Thunderbird. I desperately need to move some folders of emails from the old computer to the new one. I can't find a way to do that. I went to a link that said the import/export tool no longer works. I tried archiving the messages in a folder but have no idea where they went. Luckily I could undo that. What is the best way to move these folders of emails to the new computer? It was really easy many years ago.
creator: karin32

title: Mass mailing problems
content:
This is my second query about thunderbird mass mailings. I want to explain exactly what my situation is. I am an historian and a well-published author. Publishing has gone crazy in the last 10-15 years, and as a result, I have had to self-publish two books,. one quite recently. There's a self-publishing network out there, and I was able to purchase an email database covering about 7,000 libraries. The data base is on excel spreadsheets and I had done one mailing with them a couple of years ago, via gmail. However, that gmail acocunt isn't working now, and their support hasn't been able to fix that.

My publishing house domain, mountgreylockbooks.com, has several thunderbird email accounts, and I decided to try one of those. I immediately ran into the 500 a day limit. So I started breaking the sheets down into 500-entry sheets and sending one a day--and for about five days, that worked just fine. In addition, the mailing had a very measurable effect on my amazon ranking for the book. It was going to take a while to reach the whole list, but things seemed to be on track. About 10 per cent of the emails were bouncing back but that was mostly because people had left their jobs and the addresses were no longer valid.

Yesterday, however, when I hit send for the mass mailing, the mailing began coming to a halt almost immediately. I had a long online session with a tech at BigScoots, who host my web site. He couldn't figure out what to do, and suggested I try mail chimp. So I signed up for a one month free account and had a tech on the line there this morning, and it turned out that they would not work for me unless the people on my email list had subscribed to my mailings--which of course they had not. The maling itself isn't spam at all. It just tells them about the availability of a new book and tells them who I am. And let me stress this: if I can get this mailing to work, there won't be any more mailings for years.

So if anyone can help me either with the thunderbird error or with some other solution, I'd be very appreciative. Thanks. 

                 David Kaiser

You can read about the book here: https://www.amazon.com/States-Union-David-Kaiser/dp/1732874530
creator: KaiserD2
